SEARCH
Package MODE

Class Individual

java.lang.Object
MODE.Individual
public class Individual extends Object
Represents an individual entity within the simulation that navigates a grid, can reproduce, and has a lifecycle defined by birth and death times. Each individual maintains a path of visited coordinates and has associated properties like cost and comfort of its path.

  • Constructor Details

    • Individual

      public Individual(Coordenadas start, int birth, int death)
      Constructs a new Individual with a specified starting position, birth time, and death time. This constructor is typically used for initial individuals in the simulation.
      Parameters:
      start - The initial Coordenadas of the individual.
      birth - The simulated time of birth.
      death - The simulated time of death.

    • Individual

      public Individual(Coordenadas start, int birth, int death, Individual parent, List<Coordenadas> inheritedPath)
      Constructs a new Individual that is a child of an existing parent, inheriting a portion of the parent's path.
      Parameters:
      start - The initial Coordenadas of the child, which should be the last coordinate of the inherited path.
      birth - The simulated time of birth.
      death - The simulated time of death.
      parent - The parent Individual from whom this individual was reproduced.
      inheritedPath - A List of Coordenadas representing the path inherited from the parent.

      public int getY()
      Returns the current y-coordinate of the individual.

      public Coordenadas getCurrentPosition()
      Returns the current position of the individual as a Coordenadas object.
      Returns:
      The current Coordenadas.

    • getLastPosition

      public Coordenadas getLastPosition()
      Returns the last position recorded in the individual's path.
      Returns:
      The Coordenadas of the last visited point.

    • getPath

      public List<Coordenadas> getPath()
      Returns the complete path traversed by the individual.
      Returns:
      A List of Coordenadas representing the individual's path.

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Returns the length of the individual's path (number of edges traversed). This is calculated as the number of coordinates in the path minus one.
      Returns:
      The length of the path.

    • getBirthTime

      public int getBirthTime()
      Returns the simulated birth time of the individual.
      Returns:
      The birth time.

    • getDeathTime

      public int getDeathTime()
      Returns the simulated death time of the individual.
      Returns:
      The death time.

    • setBirthTime

      public void setBirthTime(int t)
      Sets the simulated birth time of the individual.
      Parameters:
      t - The new birth time.

    • setDeathTime

      public void setDeathTime(int t)
      Sets the simulated death time of the individual.
      Parameters:
      t - The new death time.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(Coordenadas next)
      Moves the individual to the specified next coordinate, updating its current position and adding the new coordinate to its path. After moving, it attempts to remove any cycles from the path to optimize it.
      Parameters:
      next - The Coordenadas to which the individual will move.

    • removeCycles

      private void removeCycles()
      Optimizes the individual's path by removing any cycles (loops). If a previously visited coordinate is encountered, the path is truncated back to the first occurrence of that coordinate, effectively removing the loop. This ensures the path is a simple path (no repeated vertices except for the start/end in a cycle).

    • getCost

      public int getCost(Grid grid)
      Calculates the total cost of the individual's current path on the given grid. The cost is determined by summing the costs of individual edges, as provided by the grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - The Grid on which the path exists, used to determine edge costs.
      Returns:
      The total accumulated cost of the path.

    • getComfort

      public double getComfort(Grid grid, Coordenadas target, int k)
      Calculates a "comfort" metric for the individual's current path. This metric is influenced by the path's cost, length, the maximum possible edge cost in the grid, and the Manhattan distance to the target. The formula used is based on the problem description's comfort function.
      Parameters:
      grid - The Grid context for path cost and max edge cost.
      target - The Coordenadas of the target destination.
      k - A weighting factor applied to the comfort calculation.
      Returns:
      The calculated comfort value, normalized between 0.001 and 0.999.

    • getComfortAtPosition

      public double getComfortAtPosition(Grid grid, Coordenadas pos, int targetIndex, int k)
      Calculates the potential comfort of the individual's path if it were to move to a hypothetical new position. This method temporarily adds the new position to the path, calculates comfort, and then reverts the path and position. This is useful for evaluating potential next moves.
      Parameters:
      grid - The Grid context for path cost and max edge cost.
      pos - The hypothetical next Coordenadas to evaluate.
      targetIndex - An index used to derive the target coordinates (e.g., in a flat grid representation). Assumes target is derived from (targetIndex / m) + 1 and (targetIndex % m) + 1.
      k - A weighting factor applied to the comfort calculation.
      Returns:
      The calculated comfort value if the individual were to move to 'pos'.

    • reproduz

      public Individual reproduz(int k, Grid grid, Coordenadas target)
      Creates a new child individual by "reproducing" from the current individual. The child inherits a prefix of the parent's path, with the length of the prefix being determined by a formula involving a 'comfort' factor (phi). Specifically, the child inherits 90% of the parent's path plus an additional percentage (up to 10%) based on the parent's comfort. The child is initialized with birth and death times typically set to 0 and 0, implying they will be set later by the simulation context.
      Parameters:
      k - A weighting factor used in the comfort calculation for determining the inherited path length.
      grid - The Grid context for calculating the parent's comfort.
      target - The Coordenadas of the simulation's target destination, used for comfort calculation.
      Returns:
      A new Individual representing the child.
